intro: Helianthemum zheguliense, commonly known as the Zheguli rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It is a member of the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic plant.
